original: Sven, direktör, Göteborg. f. 9/8/78 i Gbg av grossh. Justus W. o. Maria Eriksson. G. 09 m. Ingeborg Swensoin. Barn: Kerstin f. 10, g. m. major Thure Moss, Uddevailla, Birgit 16, g. m. stads no t. Erik Gärde, Gbg. — Stud. v. Gbgs hand:inst. 94-%, tont :prakt. i Engtl., Frankr. o. TyslM. 98-00. Styr:ordf. i Red. A-B Coincordia, Red. A-B Unda, Red. A-B Castella samt i Gbgs o. Bo,h. 1. sparb., v. ordf. i Gbgs hand :ibank, styr :lied. i Västergötil.-Gbgs Järnv. A-B, Lidköp.-(Skara)-Stenstorps Järnv. A-B o. Mariestad-Moholim Järnv. A-B. RVO. , Arvid Natanael, direktör, Nässjö, f. 17/3/86 i Nässjö av folk-skoll. J. A. W. o. Matilda Carlsson. G. 17 m. Ebba Olsson. Barn: Gunvor f. 18, kemist v. Sv. Metallv., Västerås, Brittmarie 19, g. m. kont. Carl Samuelsson, Nässjö, Ulla 24, barnSiköt., Sthlm. — Hand:inst. Kont:anst. o. journ. 01-06, medarb. i ett flert. tidn. 01-09, eg. boktryck. fr. 07, dir. f. Wallerströmis Boktryck. A-B 17-30, f. Tryck. A-B Grafia fr. 31, red. o. utg. av Nässjö Nyheter 10-16, Sävsjö Nyheter 10-15, Nässjö-Tidn. 20-22, Smål. Dagbl. 22, Smål. boktryck rfören. medd. - Boktryckaren fr. 32. Sv. Tel:byråns Småliomtb. 07-16. Styriled. i Smål:krets. av Sv. tidn :-utg:fören. 20-22, led. av styr., arb :ut-sk. o. valnd i Sv. boktryck :fören. fr. 37, sekr. i Smål. boktryck :fören. fr. 32, v. ordf. 41, ordf. fr. 47, omb. v. Svenska boktryck :fören. möten fr. 34, sekr. o. ordf. i Nässjö idr rfören. 04-12, sekr. i Nässjö fornm :- o. hemb ifören. 09-10, sekr. o. v. ordf. i Wallbohaga sommarh ifören. 15-3’7, ordf. fr. 37, medl. av Publ ikl. fr. 15, ordf. i Nässjö turistfören. fr. 38, styriled. i Nässjö hemb ifören. 39-47, v. ordf. 44-46, ordf. i Skidfrämj. lokiavd. fr. 41, ordf. i fören. Nässjö sporthem fr. 41, i fören. Lövliults vänn. fr. 44, i Skidfrämj. Smiåliförb. fr. 46, styriled. i Skidfrämj. centristyr. fr. 43, i Vätterns o. Jönköp. 1. turisttraf ifören. fr. 38, led. av dess arbiutsk. fr. 40, led. av styr. o. arb:-utsk. i Jönköp. 1. hembiförb. fr. 41, omb. f. riksantikv lämb. f. Nässjö o. omnejd, styriled. i Smål. vänn., sekr. i stift. Hilda o. C. D. Petersons minne fr. 43, i fören. Nässjöpojkarna fr. 41, sekr. o. förste komm. f. turist- o. hemb:-mässa i Nässjö 39, sekr. i stift. S ita Valborgs kapell i Lövhult fr. 45, led. av kyrkofullm. 43-46, av styr, f. skol-bibl. fr. 44, sekr. i Södra torgets fas-tigh läg ifören. fr. 30’. Skr. i Nässjöboken (17), Smål. näringsliv (7 bd, 17-22), Sv. näringsliv (13 bd, 23-39) m. fl. Ledare f. studires. i Tyskl., Belg. o. Frankr. 3’5-36. Jönköp. 1. hembiförb. förtj I GM, Skid- o. friluftsfrämj. GM o. jeton i brons. Sv. Turistfören. SM o. hedidipL, Samf. f. hemb iv. i Sthlm jeton i brons, Nässjö IF hed idipl. m. fl.
translated:
Sven, director, Gothenburg. Born on August 9, 1878 in Gothenburg to merchant Justus W. and Maria Eriksson. Married in 1909 to Ingeborg Swensoin. Children: Kerstin, born in 1910, married to Major Thure Moss, Uddevalla; Birgit, born in 1916, married to town councilor Erik Gärde, Gothenburg. Studied at the Gothenburg Commercial Institute from 1894 to 1898, with practical training in England, France, and Germany from 1898 to 1900. Chairman of the Board for A-B Coincordia Publishing, A-B Unda Publishing, A-B Castella Publishing, Gothenburg Savings Bank, Vice Chairman of Gothenburg Commercial Bank, and Board member of West Gothia-Gothenburg Railway AB, Lidköping-(Skara)-Stenstorp Railway AB, and Mariestad-Moholm Railway AB. Received the Order of Vasa (Royal Order of the Vasa). 

Arvid Natanael, director, Nässjö. Born on March 17, 1886 in Nässjö to elementary school teacher J. A. W. and Matilda Carlsson. Married in 1917 to Ebba Olsson. Children: Gunvor, born in 1918, chemist at Swedish Metallurgical Company in Västerås; Brittmarie, born in 1919, married to clerk Carl Samuelsson, Nässjö; Ulla, born in 1924, housewife in Stockholm. Worked as a clerk and journalist from 1901 to 1906, a contributor to several newspapers from 1901 to 1909, owned a printing company since 1907. Was the director of Wallerström's Printing Company AB from 1917 to 1930, founder of Grafia Printing AB from 1931, editor and publisher of Nässjö News from 1910 to 1916, Sävsjö News from 1910 to 1915, Nässjö Times from 1920 to 1922, Småland Daily from 1922, Småland Printing Association contributor. Secretary of the Swedish Newspaper Publishers Association from 1932, Vice Chairman from 1941, Chairman from 1947, representative at meetings of the Swedish Printing Association from 1934, Secretary and Chairman of the Nässjö Sports Association from 1904 to 1912, Secretary of the Nässjö Antiquities and Homeland Association from 1909 to 1910, Secretary and Vice Chairman of Wallbohaga Summer Retreat Association from 1915 to 1937, Chairman since 1937, member of the Publishing Council from 1915, Chairman of the Nässjö Tourist Association from 1938, Board member of the Nässjö Homeland Association from 1939 to 1947, Vice Chairman from 1944 to 1946, Chairman of the Ski Promotion Local Division from 1941, Chairman of Nässjö Sports Home Association from 1941, Chairman of Lövhults Friends Association from 1944, Chairman of the Ski Promotion Småland Association from 1946, Board member of the Ski Promotion Central Committee from 1943, Board member of the Vättern and Jönköping County Tourist Traffic Association from 1938, member of its working committee from 1940, member of the Board and working committee of the Jönköping County Homeland Association from 1941, representative for national heritage conservation in Nässjö and surrounding areas, Board member of the Småland Friends Association, Secretary of the Hilda and C. D. Peterson Foundation from 1943, member of the Nässjö Boys Association from 1941, Secretary and First Commander for tourist and homeland fairs in Nässjö in 1939, Secretary of the St. Walburga Chapel in Lövhult from 1945, member of the church council from 1943 to 1946, member of the Board for school libraries from 1944, Secretary of the South Square Property Owners Association from 1930. Writings include Nässjö Book (17), Småland Business Life (7 volumes, 1917-1922), Swedish Business Life (13 volumes, 1923-1939), and many more. Volunteer leader for study trips to Germany, Belgium, and France from 1935 to 1936. Honorary Medal from the Jönköping County Homeland Association, Skiing and Outdoor Promotion Honorary Medal and Bronze Token, Swedish Tourist Association Silver Medal and Honorary Diploma, Stockholm Society for Home Economics Bronze Token, Nässjö Sports Association Honorary Diploma, etc.
